title: Did Merriam-Webster Update Its Entry on ‘Sexual Preference’ After Barrett Hearing?
subtitle: U.S. Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett had been described by advocacy groups as “hostile to the rights of LGBTQ people.”
author: Madison Dapcevich
vclaim: Merriam-Webster updated its definition and usage guidelines of the term "sexual preference" to say its use is "offensive" after the Oct. 13, 2020, confirmation hearing of Judge Amy Coney Barrett, U.S. President Donald Trump’s pick for the Supreme Court.
